hints.content:
Let's find the pattern that connects each number.

$20\underset{\blueD?}{{\rightarrow}}40\underset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} 60 \underset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} 80$

The pattern starts at $20$ and adds $20$ each time.

$20\underset{\blueD{+~20}}{{\rightarrow}}40\underset{\blueD{+~20}}{\rightarrow} 60 \underset{\blueD{+~20}}{\rightarrow} 80$

So, if we want to know what the $8$th number will be, we need to extend the pattern:

$\overset{\greenD1}{20}\underset{\blueD{+~20}}{{\rightarrow}}\overset{\greenD2}{40}\underset{\blueD{+~20}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD3}{60} \underset{\blueD{+~20}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD4} {80} \underset{\blueD{+~20}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD5}{100} \underset{\blueD{+~20}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD6}{120} \underset{\blueD{+~20}} {\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD7}{140} \underset{\blueD{+~20}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD8}{160}$
The $8^{\text{th}}$ number in the pattern will be $160$.
